availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel G. Rogers (Nicholas County constable, farmer, soldier)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, constable, farmer, and soldier. Nicholas County, Kentucky, native. Son of Willis C. Rogers and Hepsey Rogers. Married to Drucilla Wright Rogers in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on November 7, 1853. Married to Josephine Peterson Rogers in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on May 17, 1859. Father of John L. Rogers and Carie E. Rogers. Constable in Nicholas County in 1850. Resident of Fleming County in 1853. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860.
